poem:
### At the Helm

Sue Gray 
quietly 
steers the ship—  
between whispers 
and nods,  
a pen poised  
over the future,  
she navigates  
the stormy seas,  
transitions  
from old  
to new  
as if carving rivers  
of change,  
leaving ripples  
in each room  
she enters.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Who are the key people inside Labour’s leadership team? At the helm of Keir Starmer’s new Downing Street operation will be Sue Gray, Keir Starmer’s all powerful chief of staff, who has quickly become his political fixer and mediator in the 10 months she has been in post. The former senior civil servant had responsibility for the Labour party’s transition to power, and will now be in the room for every big decision, from who". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
